intro: Acineta wolteriana, commonly known as the mountain sandwort, is a small flowering plant belonging to the family Montiaceae. It is native to South America, particularly found in Argentina and Chile, where it thrives in high-altitude environments. The plant is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit and small, fleshy leaves that help it conserve water in arid conditions. Its flowers, typically white or pale pink, are clustered in dense inflorescences and bloom during the summer months. Acineta wolteriana is adapted to rocky and sandy soils, making it a resilient species in harsh, mountainous climates.
